intro: Chabraea canescens, commonly known as the silver chabraea, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its silver-gray foliage due to a dense covering of fine hairs. The plant produces showy, bell-shaped flowers that are typically blue or violet in color. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in rocky or alpine habitats. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
